title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: Prince Harry Given Permission To Challenge UK Police Protection Ruling
entries.description: Prince Harry has been given permission to appeal against the rejection of his legal challenge to the British government's decision to take away his police protection when he is in Britain, his lawyer said on Thursday.

entries.title: "Just Words": Hamas Responds To Joe Biden's Gaza Ceasefire Plan
entries.description: A senior Hamas official said Thursday that US President Joe Biden's proposed Gaza ceasefire deal was "just words" and the Palestinian group had not received any written commitments related to a truce.

entries.title: Massive SpaceX Starship Rocket Returns To Earth, Makes Soft Landing In Ocean
entries.description: SpaceX's massive Starship rocket achieved its first ever splashdown during a test flight Thursday, in a major milestone for the prototype system that may one day send humans to Mars.

entries.title: Zelenskyy Congratulates PM Modi For Poll Win, Invites Him To Ukraine
entries.description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said he spoke with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and discussed the upcoming peace summit in Switzerland concerning the Russia-Ukrainian war and hoped for India's participation at the

entries.title: Surge In Migrant Crossings At US-Mexico Border Sparks Political Dispute
entries.description: Propped up against the rusty steel slats of the border wall, migrant families who hours before crossed the U.S.-Mexico border rest under tarps and tents and await Border Patrol officers.

entries.title: Chinese Space Plane Releases Unidentified Object In Orbit: All About It
entries.description: China has kept the mission shrouded in secrecy, with the country's space authorities refraining from releasing any images or descriptions of the spacecraft.

entries.title: 'Tsar Mangal' - Russia's Response To Ukraine's Drone Attacks On Tanks
entries.description: Drones have dominated the battlefield in Ukraine, with cheap, unmanned ground/aerial vehicles taking out tanks worth several thousand dollars.

entries.title: 30 Belonging To "Satanist Network" Arrested In Iran: Report
entries.description: Iranian authorities have arrested 30 people suspected of belonging to a "satanist network" at an event with "alcoholic drinks", local media reported Thursday in the latest such raid in recent weeks.

entries.title: "Like Going Back Home": Sunita Williams On Flying To Space Station
entries.description: On her third journey to space, Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams riding on the Boeing Starliner spacecraft is likely to reach what she has described as "her home" in space - the International Space Station - today at 9.45 pm.

entries.title: Thailand Warns "Jurassic World" Producers Over Filming Impact On Environment
entries.description: Thai officials have given "Jurassic World" producers a stern warning not to damage beaches and national parks when they film the next instalment of the blockbuster franchise in the kingdom.

entries.title: British Paratroopers Passports Checked Moments After D-Day Drop In France
entries.description: British paratroopers recreating an airdrop behind German defences to mark the 80th anniversary of D-Day were met by French customs officials at a makeshift border checkpost.

entries.title: Married TV Anchor In US Resigns After Sexting Man Posing As 15-Year-Old
entries.description: The case came to light after 59-year-old Bill Lunn arranged a meetup with the suspected underage girl at his home.

entries.title: Spain To Join South Africa's Case Against Gaza "Genocide" In UN Top Court
entries.description: Spain said on Thursday that it will join South Africa's case at the UN's top court in which Pretoria has accused Israel of "genocide" in the Gaza Strip.

entries.title: Sudanese Paramilitary Forces Attack Village, Kill 100 People: Report
entries.description: The Sudanese paramilitary Rapid Support Forces attacked a village in Gezira State on Wednesday, killing at least 100 people, according to local activists.

entries.title: On Camera, Woman Struck Dead By Train In Mexico While Taking Selfie
entries.description: Mexican outlets said the woman was in her 20s and said she was with her son and children from a nearby school.

entries.title: Fancy Teacups, Rs 3.8 Crore Pool: 5 Times UK PM Rishi Sunak Came Under Fire
entries.description: Despite his historic appointment as the first British-Asian Prime Minister and the first Hindu to hold the office, Mr Sunak's tenure has not been without controversy.

entries.title: Its Forces Halved, Hamas Relies On Hit-And-Run Tactics To Frustrate Israel
entries.description: Hamas has seen about half its forces wiped out in eight months of war and is relying on hit-and-run insurgent tactics to frustrate Israel's attempts to take control of Gaza, U.S. and Israeli officials told Reuters.

entries.title: In A First, Paris Olympics Village To Have "Mindfulness Area" For Athletes
entries.description: Three years after gymnastics superstar Simone Biles put the mental health of athletes centre stage at the Tokyo Olympics, this year's Paris Games will demonstrate how greater awareness has translated into better care and support.

entries.title: US Regulators Target Microsoft, OpenAI Violations In AI Antitrust Probe
entries.description: The US Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission have reached a deal that allows them to proceed with antitrust investigations into the dominant roles that Microsoft, OpenAI and Nvidia play in the artificial intelligence industry.

entries.title: World's Most Powerful Rocket, That May Send Man To Mars, To Be Tested Soon
entries.description: Starship, SpaceX's massive prototype rocket that may one day send humans to Mars, is poised for its next flight on Thursday.
